title: Pink Floyd
subtitle: A unique journey with Wikidata to discover one of the most renowned British music bands of all time
description: We started our investigation analysing the number of British music bands. In particular, we focused on the rock genre as we are really interested in, and of course we couldn’t help but to center deeply on probably the most renowned and influencing music band of all time: Pink Floyd. They became known for their biting political, social and emotional commentary.

dynamic_elements.text: The band was born back to 1963 thanks to the meeting of three architecture students from the University of London, Roger Waters, Nick Mason e Richard Wright. At first, the band didn’t have the unique name with which everyone knows them, but they changed it several times: for example, they used to call themselves Spectrum Five, Tea Set, etc. Finally, they switched to Pink Floyd in 1965, combining the names of two bluesmen, Pink Anderson and Floyd Council.

category: Show other bands from this genre
country: Show other bands from this country
genre: Show other bands from this genre

dynamic_elements.table_title: When did Pink Floyd start their activity?

dynamic_elements.text: Pink Floyd began their career at the vanguard of London's underground music scene. They rapidly achieved great success and they were always keen on exploring more into various music genres. In fact, they were the founders of two major music movements: psychedelic space-rock and blues-based progressive rock.

dynamic_elements.action_title: Show other bands from this country
Show other bands from this genre

dynamic_elements.text: Pink Floyd are known for their wide range of instruments, which belong to different genres and are combined harmoniously to create their songs. Moreover, it’s notorious their use of non-musical sounds, a distinctive feature of the band. Pink Floyd are masters in creating atmospheres, anticipating situations, and giving sensations.

dynamic_elements.table_query:
SELECT (?instrumentLabel AS ?instrument)
WHERE { wd:Q2306 wdt:P527 ?member. ?member wdt:P1303 ?instrument. ?instrument rdfs:label ?instrumentLabel. 
       FILTER (lang(?instrumentLabel) = "en"). }
GROUP BY ?instrument ?instrumentLabel 
LIMIT 10

dynamic_elements.text: On March 1983 Pink Floyd released The Final Cut, the band’s last album with Roger Waters. From this moment, the bassist will separate from his bandmates to pursue a solo career. In fact, he still tours to sing the band’s most renowned songs in many countries around the world including Italy, where he exhibited in Bologna last April.

dynamic_elements.table_query:
SELECT DISTINCT (?label AS ?album) (year(xsd:dateTime(?date)) as ?date) 
WHERE { ?album wdt:P31 wd:Q482994 . ?album wdt:P175 wd:Q2306 . ?album wdt:P577 ?date .
       SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". ?album rdfs:label ?label. } }
GROUP BY ?label ?date 
ORDER BY ?date

SELECT DISTINCT ?song ?songLabel 

WHERE { ?song wdt:P175 wd:Q2306; wdt:P407 wd:Q1860. ?song wdt:P577 ?publicationDate. 
       SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". } } 

LIMIT 20

dynamic_elements.chart_query:
SELECT DISTINCT ?label (COUNT(distinct ?band) as ?count) 
WHERE { ?band ?a wd:Q2306 . # pink floyd
       ?band wdt:P495 wd:Q38 . # from italy 
       ?band wdt:P737 ?influencer . 
       SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". ?influencer rdfs:label ?label. } } 
GROUP BY ?label ?count ORDER BY DESC(?count) 
LIMIT 10
